pros: Fast as hell; Comfort written all over it; Super smooth ride; Light AF; Protection can't be more awesome; Breathable under warm temps; Toe box is ready for ultras; Carbon plate is not harsh; Grippy on wet, loose, and soft trails; Also great for the roads
cons: Unstable at slow paces; Loose heel
RR_verdict: The Endorphin Edge from Saucony is the brand's bounce-back from the not-so-great Saucony Endorphin Trail. And this time around, we see a premium shoe that has a carbon-fiber plate, is max-cushioned, and can go fast, fast, fast. Even better, we discovered that it's now ready for runs ranging from short to long distances.
awards: Top pick in best Saucony trail running shoes
